The tentative agreement was the flagship deal signed Thursday at the annual St. Petersburg International Economic Forum, where Russian officials touted participation by foreign executives as a sign the country hadn’t been isolated by Western sanctions.

MOSCOW—Russia’s state gas firm OAO Gazprom signed a preliminary deal with three European companies to expand a pipeline to Germany, aiming to cement the company as the European Union’s main gas supplier even as it faces antimonopoly charges there.
